{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3380336,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-05T19:42:31.933Z","cooked":"

I noticed in the example for SysIdRoutine that angular position is fed into the mechanism for the routine. Is this necessary if all I care about is velocity. I know I won’t be able to do position characterization, but I don’t really need to for a flywheel.

Position shouldn’t be needed to run a flywheel analysis.

Thank you.
I’m assuming that sysId will either given garbage data or crash if I try to do position feedback analysis with no position data?

Nah; the only thing the position data is used for is gravity compensation in the arm routine.

Really. That simplifies things immensely.

I just thought it was required for position feedback as well.

So I’m assuming the shooter example just has it to demonstrate more of the class involved.

So this could hold true for characterizing a turret or anything else not requiring gravity compensation?
